question.title: Download artifact from Maven via CLI from a custom repository to a custom destination
question.body:
I need to download an artifact from a (custom) Maven repository to a specific location, using Maven via the CLI, outside of an actual Maven project.

I currently do this using something like:

mvn \
  dependency:2.10:get \
  -DremoteRepositories="https://repository.jboss.org" \
  -Dartifact="ace.contrib:ace:6.0.1:zip:vc9x32" \
  -Ddest="artifact.zip" \
  -Dtransitive=false

Note - the artifact here is arbitrary, it's simply one that's not on Maven central.

The problem is that maven-dependency-plugin:2.10 is over 10 years old, and newer versions no longer include the dest parameter.

The deprecation notice suggestion doesn't help either:

[WARNING] Parameter 'destination' (user property 'dest') is deprecated: if you need to copy the resolved artifact, use dependency:copy

Because dependency:copy doesn't support custom repository specification - even if you already have the ace.contrib:ace:6.0.1:zip:vc9x32 artifact locally - because this invocation can't resolve it, it fails.

mvn dependency:copy -Dartifact="ace.contrib:ace:6.0.1:zip:vc9x32"  

[INFO] Artifact ace.contrib:ace:pom:6.0.1 is present in the local repository, but cached from a remote repository ID that is unavailable in current build context, verifying that is downloadable from [central (https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2, default, releases)]
[WARNING] The POM for ace.contrib:ace:zip:vc9x32:6.0.1 is missing, no dependency information available
{...}
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-dependency-plugin:3.7.0:copy (default-cli) on project standalone-pom: Unable to find/resolve artifact.: The following artifacts could not be resolved: ace.contrib:ace:zip:vc9x32:6.0.1 (present, but unavailable): ace.contrib:ace:zip:vc9x32:6.0.1 was not found in https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2 during a previous attempt. This failure was cached in the local repository and resolution is not reattempted until the update interval of central has elapsed or updates are forced

Requirements:

  • download an artifact (including classifier and packaging specification)
  • from a custom repository URL (that may require authentication)
  • to a custom destination directory
  • ideally with a custom destination filename
  • via Maven so it can be cross-platform

answers.body:
• The simplest way is to manually edit pom.xml
  • and then execute command mvn clean dependency:copy-dependencies -DoutputDirectory=target

app project

app
└── pom.xml

pom.xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 https://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
    <groupId>com.example</groupId>
    <artifactId>demo</artifactId>
    <version>0.0.1-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <name>demo</name>

  <dependencies>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>ace.contrib</groupId>
      <artifactId>ace</artifactId>
      <version>6.0.1</version>
      <classifier>vc9x32</classifier>
      <type>zip</type>
    </dependency>
  </dependencies>

 <repositories>
    <repository>
      <id>jboss-thirdparty-releases</id>
      <name>JBoss 3rd-party Releases</name>
      <url>https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/thirdparty-releases/</url>
    </repository>
  </repositories>

</project>

Command

mvn clean dependency:copy-dependencies -DoutputDirectory=target

result: download file is under target directory

app
├── pom.xml
└── target
    └── ace-6.0.1-vc9x32.zip

question_comments.body: Why not just copy the artifact to the desired place (or rename it to the desired name) after the download? Maybe you could write a short shell script, bat file or Java program. If you describe your use case in more detail, we might find a better solution for you (so why are you downloading these files, and is this part of a script, program or  a manual task).

79798434.body: @JackPGreen The simplest way is to manually edit pom.xml and then execute mvn clean dependency:copy-dependencies -DoutputDirectory=target.
Creating a batch file or shell script is not cross-platform.
